body_html:
Reinstall anaconda from scratch in a different folder, and set your PATH to use the binaries there.

If the build directory is root, that means you accidentally ran the build as root before which left some files chowned as root. The easiest way to fix it is to make a new build directory as non-root, and NEVER run build commands as root.
body_text:
Reinstall anaconda from scratch in a different folder, and set your PATH to use the binaries there.
If the build directory is root, that means you accidentally ran the build as root before which left some files chowned as root. The easiest way to fix it is to make a new build directory as non-root, and NEVER run build commands as root.
body:
Reinstall anaconda from scratch in a different folder, and set your PATH to use the binaries there.

If the build directory is root, that means you accidentally ran the build as root before which left some files chowned as root. The easiest way to fix it is to make a new build directory as non-root, and NEVER run build commands as root.
